columns.text: In this problem, we need to determine the annual sales figure that we will use to evaluate the project.
When introducing a new project, the forecast on how much revenue it can bring is vital since this can show whether the erosion it brings on other products will be worth it.

Firstly, we will solve for the current revenue of the firm without the project. We can do this by multiplying the price and the units for each product then adding them together. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Revenue}&=(20,000 \times \$97,000) + (14,000 \times \$145,000)\\[15 pt]
&=\$3,970,000,000
\end{aligned}$$

The current revenue of the firm is $\$3,970,000,000$

Now we can assess the revenue of the firm with the project. Take note that if the project is launched, the expected number of sales for the motor homes will increase by $2,700$ and the motor coaches will decrease by $1,300$. Aside from that, it is expected that the project will $30,000$ units at $\$21,000$ each.

With the values above, the revenue with the project will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Revenue}&=(22,700 \times \$97,000) +(12,700\times \$145,000)\\
&+(30,000 \times \$21,000)\\[15 pt]
&=\$4,673,400,000
\end{aligned}$$

The estimated revenue with the project is $\$4,673,400,000$

To solve for the annual sales that will be used for the project, we will take the difference between the revenue with the project and the revenue without the project. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Annual sales}&=\$4,673,400,000-\$3,970,000,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$703,400,000
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the annual sales if the project is implemented, will be $\$703,400,000$

This is the value that will be used as it indicates whether the project is profitable despite the negative effects it has on the firm's current products. Based on the calculation, the project is indeed profitable.
